message: Any JavaScript Ninjas around for a quick fix? Want to hide an "Img" upon a specific action is triggered?

data.message: See the white logo at the first screen here: http://www.makeit.intel.com/ once you scroll down the logo is replaced by a new header. We are doing something similar and wan t to hide/delete the logo once the "header" is triggered.
The header becomes fixed once you scroll to a distance equivalent to the document's height ... That should be easily done with jQuery
Thanks Ahmad, the case is slightly different with us, you can check it from http://egypreneur.com/beta it's not associated with a certain height.
This is even simpler ... Just check if the scroll position is > 0 and hide the header image :)
Your link is no longer working. But you can easily use the Jquery method hide() to hide any element if that is what you need.
